verses.verse: (For the choir director, for Jeduthun. A Psalm of David.) I said,<WH559> "I will guard<WH8104> my ways,<WH1870> That I may not sin<WH2398> with my tongue;<WH3956> I will guard<WH8104> my mouth<WH6310> as with a muzzle,<WH4269> While<WH5750> the wicked<WH7563> are in my presence.<WH5048>"
I was dumb<WH481> and silent,<WH1747> I refrained<WH2814> [even] from good;<WH9185> And my sorrow<WH3511> grew<WH5916> worse.<WH5916>
My heart<WH3820> was hot<WH2552> within<WH7130> me; While I was musing<WH1901> the fire<WH784> burned;<WH1197> [Then] I spoke<WH1696> with my tongue: <WH3956>
"Lord,<WH3068> make me to know<WH3045> my end,<WH7093> And what<WH4100> is the extent<WH4060> of my days,<WH3117> Let me know<WH3045> how<WH4100> transient<WH2310> I am.

"Behold,<WH2009> Thou hast made<WH5414> my days<WH3117> [as] handbreadths,<WH2947> And my lifetime<WH2465> as nothing<WH369> in Thy sight,<WH5048> Surely<WH389> every<WH3605> man<WH120> at his best<WH5324> is a mere<WH3605> breath.<WH1892> Selah.<WH5542>

"Surely<WH389> every<WH376> man<WH376> walks<WH1980> about as a phantom;<WH6754> Surely<WH389> they make<WH1993> an uproar<WH1993> for nothing;<WH1892> He amasses<WH6651> [riches], and does not know<WH3045> who<WH4310> will gather<WH622> them.
"And now,<WH6258> Lord,<WH136> for what<WH4100> do I wait<WH6960>? My hope<WH8431> is in Thee.
"Deliver<WH5337> me from all<WH3605> my transgressions;<WH6588> Make<WH7760> me not the reproach<WH2781> of the foolish.<WH5036>
"I have become<WH481> dumb,<WH481> I do not open<WH6605> my mouth,<WH6310> Because<WH3588> it is Thou who hast done<WH6213> [it.]
"Remove<WH5493> Thy plague<WH5061> from me; Because<WH4480> of the opposition<WH8409> of Thy hand,<WH3027> I am perishing.<WH3615>

"With reproofs<WH9640> Thou dost chasten<WH3256> a man<WH376> for iniquity;<WH5771> Thou dost consume<WH4529> as a moth<WH6211> what is precious<WH2530> to him; Surely<WH389> every<WH3605> man<WH120> is a mere<WH1892> breath.<WH1892> Selah.<WH5542>

"Hear<WH8085> my prayer,<WH8605> O Lord,<WH3068> and give<WH238> ear<WH238> to my cry;<WH7775> Do not be silent<WH2790> at my tears;<WH1832> For I am a stranger<WH1616> with Thee, A sojourner<WH8453> like all<WH3605> my fathers.
"Turn<WH8159> Thy gaze<WH8159> away<WH8159> from me, that I may smile<WH1082> [again], Before<WH2962> I depart<WH1980> and am no<WH369> more.<WH369>"
